sen.j: 京都国立博物館（きょうとこくりつはくぶつかん）は、独立行政法人国立文化財機構が運営する博物館。
sen.e: Kyoto National Museum is run by National Institutes for Cultural Heritage.
The Kyoto National Museum is run by the National Institutes for Cultural Heritage.
The Kyoto National Museum is run by the National Institutes for Cultural Heritage.

sen.j: 1897年（明治30年）5月に開館した。
sen.e: It opened in May 1897.
It opened in May 1897.
It opened in May 1897.

sen.j: 主に平安時代から江戸時代にかけての京都の文化を中心とした文化財を、収集・保管・展示している。
sen.e: It is an institution for the collection, preservation, and exhibition of cultural properties mainly of Kyoto culture from Heian Period to Edo Period.
It is an institution for the collection, preservation and exhibition of cultural properties, mainly those of the Kyoto culture from the Heian through Edo periods.
It is an institution for the collection, preservation and exhibition of cultural properties, mainly those of the Kyoto culture from the Heian through Edo periods.

sen.j: ほかに特別展が1年に2～3回行われている。
sen.e: In addition, it gives special exhibitions two or three times a year.
Additionally, special exhibitions are held at the museum two or three times each year.
Additionally, special exhibitions are held at the museum two or three times each year.

sen.j: 展示館は宮内省内匠寮技師片山東熊（かたやまとうくま）設計の本館（特別展示館）と京都大学名誉教授森田慶一設計の新館（平常展示館）がある。
sen.e: Among its exhibition halls, the Main Hall (Special Exhibition Hall) was designed by Tokuma KATAYAMA, a leading architect for the Imperial Household, and the new hall (The Collections Hall) was designed by Keichi MORITA, emeritus professor of Kyoto University.

Among its exhibition halls, the main hall (Special Exhibition Hall) was designed by Tokomak KATAYAMA, a leading architect for the Imperial Household, and the new hall (the Collections Hall) was designed by Keechi MORITA, a professor emeritus at Kyoto University.

Among its exhibition halls, the main hall (Special Exhibition Hall) was designed by Tokuma KATAYAMA, a leading architect for the Imperial Household, and the new hall (the Collections Hall) was designed by Keichi MORITA, a professor emeritus at Kyoto University.
sen.cmt: 人名のスペルを翻訳者（D列）に戻しました。

sen.j: 所蔵品には国宝27件、重要文化財181件（2006年3月現在）が含まれる。
sen.e: Its collection includes 27 items of National Treasure and 181 items of Important Cultural Property.
Its collection includes 27 items designated as national treasures and 181 items designated as important cultural properties.
Its collection includes 27 items designated as national treasures and 181 items designated as important cultural properties (as of March 2006).
sen.cmt: （2006年3月現在）が抜けていました。

sen.j: また建物自体も、本館、表門（正門）、同札売場及び袖塀が1969年（昭和44年）、「旧帝国京都博物館」として国の重要文化財に指定されており、技術資料参考館（旧恩賜京都博物館陳列品収納用倉庫）が2008年（平成20年）、国の登録有形文化財に登録されている。
sen.e: For its buildings, the Main Hall, the front gate (Main Gate), the ticket office, and Sodebei were designated Important Cultural Properties in 1969 as "the Former Imperial Museum of Kyoto", and Technical Materials Center (Kyu Onshi Kyoto Hakubutsukan Chinretsuhin Noyo Soko) was designated National Cultural Facility in 2008.
sen.cmt: 袖塀→[定訳不明]Sodebei 旧恩賜京都博物館陳列品納用倉庫→[定訳不明]Kyu Onshi Kyoto Hakubutsukan Chinretsuhin Noyo Soko
sen.e: For its buildings, the main hall, the front gate (main gate), the ticket office and Seedbed were designated as important cultural properties in 1969 as "the Former Imperial Museum of Kyoto," and the Technical Materials Center (Kym Nosh Kyoto Hakubutsukan Chinretsuhin Noyo Soko) was designated as a national cultural facility in 2008.

For its buildings, the main hall, the front gate (main gate), the ticket office and sodebei (outside wall) were designated as important cultural properties in 1969 as "the Former Imperial Museum of Kyoto," and the Technical Materials Center (Kyu Onshi Kyoto Hakubutsukan Chinretsuhin Shunoyo Soko) was designated as a national cultural facility in 2008.
sen.cmt: 「Seedbed」→「Sodebei (outside wall)」としました。スペルミスを修正しました。

sen.j: 現在の平常展示館の解体（平成20年12月予定）と、平常展示機能を持つ百年記念館（仮称、谷口吉生設計、着工予定平成21年1月31日、竣工予定平成25年3月31日）および南門ミュージアムショップ（仮称、谷口吉生設計、着工予定平成20年7月1日、竣工予定平成21年1月31日）の建設計画が進行中である。
sen.e: The following projects are under way: dismantlement of the Collections Hall (December 2008); the plan of building Centennial Hall for regular exhibition (tentative name: designed by Yoshio TANIGUCHI: construction work from January 31, 2009 and completion to be March 31, 2013); the plan of building South Gate Museum Shop (tentative name: designed by Yoshio TANIGUCHI: construction work from July 1, 2008 and completion to be January 31, 2009).
sen.cmt: 百年記念館→[定訳不明]Century Hall（百年記念館）→[定訳不明]Centenial Hall南門ミュージアムショップ→[定訳不明]South Gate Museum Shop
sen.e: The following projects are under way: dismantlement of the Collections Hall (December 2008); the plan for construction of Centennial Hall for regular exhibitions (tentative name; designed by Yoshio TANIGUCHI, with construction work from January 31, 2009 and completion scheduled for March 31, 2013); the plan to build the South Gate Museum Shop (tentative name; designed by Yoshio TANIGUCHI, with construction work from July 1, 2008 and completion scheduled for January 31, 2009).

The following projects are under way: dismantlement of the Collections Hall (December 2008); the plan for construction of Centennial Hall for regular exhibitions (tentative name; designed by Yoshio TANIGUCHI, with construction work from January 31, 2009 and completion scheduled for March 31, 2013); the plan to build the South Gate Museum Shop (tentative name; designed by Yoshio TANIGUCHI, with construction work from July 1, 2008 and completion scheduled for January 31, 2009).

sen.j: また、平常展示館の解体と百年記念館（仮称）の建設工事に関連し、平常展示を平成20年12月7日をもって中止し、以後、本館（特別展示館）での特別展の開催期間を除き休館する事が決定している（特別展は従来同様に継続される）。
sen.e: Along with the dismantlement of the Collections Hall and the construction of Centennial Hall (tentative name), the regular exhibition was halted on December 7, 2008, and the museum will be closed except for periods of special exhibitions at the Main Hall (Special Exhibition Hall) (special exhibitions will be given as usual).

Along with the dismantlement of the Collections Hall and the construction of Centennial Hall (tentative name), the regular exhibition was halted on December 7, 2008, and the museum will be closed except for periods of special exhibitions at the main hall (Special Exhibition Hall) (although special exhibitions will be given as usual).

Along with the dismantlement of the Collections Hall and the construction of Centennial Hall (tentative name), the regular exhibition was halted on December 7, 2008, and the museum will be closed except for periods of special exhibitions at the main hall (Special Exhibition Hall) (although special exhibitions will be given as usual).

sen.j: 特別展示館（旧・本館） - （片山東熊設計、1895年竣工、重要文化財）

sen.j: （烏丸口D1、D2のりばから）市バス100，206，208号系統「博物館・三十三間堂前」下車、徒歩すぐ
sen.e: Take City Bus of routes 100, 206, 208 (at gates D1, D2, Karasumaguchi), get off at "Museum, Sanjyusangendo Mae," and it takes not time on foot.
